Issues.Title: Upgrade rimraf: 3.0.2 ‚Üí 4.1.2 (major)
Issues.Body:
Here is everything you need to know about this upgrade. Please take a good look at what changed and the test results before merging this pull request. ### What changed? #### ‚ú≥Ô∏è rimraf (3.0.2 ‚Üí 4.1.2) ¬∑ [Repo](https://github.com/isaacs/rimraf) ¬∑ [Changelog](https://github.com/isaacs/rimraf/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md)
Commits

See the full diff on Github. The new version differs by 63 commits:

  • 4.1.2
  • typecheck the preserveRoot option properly
  • ignore unnecessary -rf or -fr
  • test that optArg throws on bad arguments
  • 4.1.1
  • fix: bundling library using webpack
  • 4.1.0
  • Improved hybrid module, no .default needed
  • 4.0.7
  • List types separately in each dist type
  • 4.0.6
  • doc: suggest named imports
  • 4.0.5
  • fix: add types
  • minor doc updates
  • 4.0.4
  • more ESM syntax issues
  • 4.0.3
  • fix syntax error in mjs
  • 4.0.2
  • Only retry for the specific thing raising EBUSY
  • 4.0.1
  • default to manual on Windows
  • 4.0.0
  • ci: reduce workload even more
  • ci: remove unnecessary lint filter
  • update action versions
  • tone down benchmark intensity
  • fix benchmark workflow yaml
  • chore: add copyright year to license
  • rewrite in TS, export hybrid, update changelog, docs
  • drop support for node versions below 14
  • gh actions workflow for benchmarks
  • tests for retry-busy behavior
  • don't test on very old node versions
  • test for fix-eperm
  • prettier formatting
  • windows: only fall back to move-remove when absolutely necessary
  • update tap
  • test: run posix test on windows, why not?
  • benchmarks
  • doc: correct os.tmp default
  • do not ever actually try to rmdir /
  • consolidate all the spellings of 'opt' into one
  • add cli script
  • accept strings, arrays of strings, and no other types
  • Do not rimraf /, override with preserveRoot:false
  • ignore ENOENT errors on Windows as well
  • skip delete-many-files test on v10, too memory intensive for old node
  • Put temp files in a temp folder
  • skip the use-native test before loading tap
  • posix: ignore ENOENT errors along the way
  • use this module for cleaning up test fixtures
  • only lint in one version (breaks on v10)
  • Promisify fs methods manually
  • ci: use a version of npm that supports peerDependencies
  • Rimraf version 4, first pass
  • build: harden isaacs-makework.yml permissions (#244)
  • Merge pull request #243 from mikesprague/main
  • docs(readme): Fix link to `mkdirp`
  • update tap
  • chore: add copyright year to license
  • ci: makework
--- ![Depfu Status](https://depfu.com/badges/edd6acd35d74c8d41cbb540c30442adf/stats.svg) [Depfu](https://depfu.com) will automatically keep this PR conflict-free, as long as you don't add any commits to this branch yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting with `@depfu rebase`.

Issues.Title: Unable to list multiple variants in arbitrary variant
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

v3.2.6

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

postcss-cli v8.4.19

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v18.12.1

**What browser are you using?**

Chrome v109

**What operating system are you using?**

macOS Ventura

**Reproduction URL**

https://play.tailwindcss.com/7TUEdEbhJH

**Describe your issue**

I'd expect to be able to do something like `[span,h1,&_h1]:font-bold` using an arbitrary variant, but that doesn't appear to work.

To better demonstrate the issue, I'll compare the CSS generated by the above utility vs. what I _think_ would be expected:

**Expected:**

```css
span,
.\[span\,\&_h1\]\:font-bold h1 {
  font-weight: 700;
}
```

**Reality:**

```css
span {
  font-weight: 700;
}
```

This is inconvenient for a couple of reasons:
* This adds a global style that matches all spans on the page, not just those matching the class
* The `h1` in the arbitrary variant gets completely ignored
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Unable to list multiple variants in arbitrary variant" (#10576)

Issues.Title: Fail Install tailwind on nodejs docker with next.js
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**
3.2.6

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

Next.js 13.1.6 

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

[For example: v12.0.0](node:18.14.0-bullseye-slim)

**What browser are you using?**

 N/A

**What operating system are you using?**

Debian bullseye slim

**Describe your issue**

When running `next build`, on a docker build:
`docker build . -t containerName --progress=plain --no-cache` I'm getting the following error:

```
#12 1.221 > next build
#12 1.221
#12 1.661 Attention: Next.js now collects completely anonymous telemetry regarding usage.
#12 1.661 This information is used to shape Next.js' roadmap and prioritize features.
#12 1.661 You can learn more, including how to opt-out if you'd not like to participate in this anonymous program, by visiting the following URL:
#12 1.661 https://nextjs.org/telemetry
#12 1.661
#12 1.799 info  - Linting and checking validity of types...
#12 5.206 info  - Creating an optimized production build...
#12 7.660 Failed to compile.
#12 7.660
#12 7.660 ./src/styles/globals.css.webpack[javascript/auto]!=!../../node_modules/next/dist/build/webpack/loaders/css-loader/src/index.js??ruleSet[1].rules[3].oneOf[11].use[1]!../../node_modules/next/dist/build/webpack/loaders/postcss-loader/src/index.js??ruleSet[1].rules[3].oneOf[11].use[2]!./src/styles/globals.css
#12 7.660 Error: Cannot find module 'tailwindcss'
#12 7.660 Require stack:
#12 7.660 - /usr/src/app/node_modules/next/dist/build/webpack/config/blocks/css/plugins.js
#12 7.660 - /usr/src/app/node_modules/next/dist/build/webpack/config/blocks/css/index.js
#12 7.660 - /usr/src/app/node_modules/next/dist/build/webpack/config/index.js
#12 7.660 - /usr/src/app/node_modules/next/dist/build/webpack-config.js
#12 7.660 - /usr/src/app/node_modules/next/dist/build/index.js
#12 7.660 - /usr/src/app/node_modules/next/dist/cli/next-build.js
#12 7.660 - /usr/src/app/node_modules/next/dist/lib/commands.js
#12 7.660 - /usr/src/app/node_modules/next/dist/bin/next
#12 7.660     at Module._resolveFilename (node:internal/modules/cjs/loader:1060:15)
#12 7.660     at mod._resolveFilename (/usr/src/app/node_modules/next/dist/build/webpack/require-hook.js:23:32)
#12 7.660     at Function.resolve (node:internal/modules/helpers:118:19)
#12 7.660     at loadPlugin (/usr/src/app/node_modules/next/dist/build/webpack/config/blocks/css/plugins.js:49:32)
#12 7.660     at /usr/src/app/node_modules/next/dist/build/webpack/config/blocks/css/plugins.js:157:56
#12 7.660     at Array.map (<anonymous>)
#12 7.660     at Object.getPostCssPlugins (/usr/src/app/node_modules/next/dist/build/webpack/config/blocks/css/plugins.js:157:47)
#12 7.660     at async /usr/src/app/node_modules/next/dist/build/webpack/config/blocks/css/index.js:92:36
#12 7.660     at async /usr/src/app/node_modules/next/dist/build/webpack/loaders/postcss-loader/src/index.js:37:41
#12 7.660     at async Span.traceAsyncFn (/usr/src/app/node_modules/next/dist/trace/trace.js:79:20)
#12 7.660
#12 7.660 Import trace for requested module:
#12 7.660 ./src/styles/globals.css.webpack[javascript/auto]!=!../../node_modules/next/dist/build/webpack/loaders/css-loader/src/index.js??ruleSet[1].rules[3].oneOf[11].use[1]!../../node_modules/next/dist/build/webpack/loaders/postcss-loader/src/index.js??ruleSet[1].rules[3].oneOf[11].use[2]!./src/styles/globals.css
#12 7.660 ./src/styles/globals.css
#12 7.660
#12 7.660 ./src/styles/globals.css
#12 7.660 Error: Cannot find module 'tailwindcss'
#12 7.660 Require stack:
#12 7.660 - /usr/src/app/node_m
```

DockerFile:

```
FROM node:18.14.0-bullseye-slim
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends dumb-init \
 && apt-get clean \
 && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*
ENV NODE_ENV production
ENV PORT 3000
WORKDIR /usr/src/app
COPY --chown=node:node . .
RUN npm install
RUN npm fund
RUN npm run telemetry-disable
RUN npm run build
USER node
EXPOSE 3000
CMD ["dumb-init", "npm", "start"]
HEALTHCHECK --interval=10s --timeout=2s --start-period=15s \  
CMD curl -fs http://localhost:3000/api/health || exit 1
```


If run it on ubuntu it works perfect. If I delete `postcss.config.js` it also builds, but tailwindcss it does not work. Also I'm using npm workspaces. You can see the full code here: https://github.com/elranu/cloudwallet/tree/50d477944cd83799f57e7dfe3cef5537c32bd2fa
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Fail Install tailwind on nodejs docker with next.js" (#10564)

Issues.Title: Not all classes in @apply end up in final css
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

v3.2.6

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

vite 4.1.1 (with postcss 8.4.21)

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

For example: v18.14.0

**What browser are you using?**

N/A

**What operating system are you using?**

WSL (Debian) --Windows

**Reproduction URL**

https://github.com/tkalmar/tailwind_bug_repro/tree/main

**Describe your issue**
In the reproducer observe `./src/components/Box.vue` there are three styles applied via `@apply` only two of them are generated into the resulting style.css (dist folder after build)
If i change the declaration from:
```postcss
.default_title {
    @apply text-xl bg-green-400 border-orange-600;
}
```
to:
```postcss
.default_title {
    @apply text-xl bg-green-400 border-orange-600 ;
}
```
(notice the space before the final `;` ) all three utility classes are generated into the resulting style.css

Expectation is to not have to include an space before the last class name
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Not all classes in @apply end up in final css" (#10562)

Issues.Title: Missing justify content "normal"
Issues.Body:
### Discussed in https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/discussions/10558
Originally posted by **DavydeVries** February 12, 2023 Hi, Currently, I'm using for viewport `sm` the class `sm:justify-center`. But I like to make the element full width on viewport `md`. The default value of `justify-content` is normally `justify-content: normal` (maybe differs on other browsers?). But there is no way to "reset" back to `normal` value. Do you have suggestions to solve my issue, or is this value missing from the core? Example: Element not full width: https://play.tailwindcss.com/pj23KKG5cV What I like to achieve/Expected behaviour: https://play.tailwindcss.com/oQ38fSUAsn Kind regards, Davy _PS. I already tried to add `normal` to my config as an "extend" but didn't get it to work._
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Missing justify content "normal"" (#10559)

Issues.Title: Formatted string variables don't work as classnames when passed as an arbitrary value
Issues.Body:
I am currently using TailwindCSS version 3.2.4 in a NextJS 13 app, built using the command `npx create-next-app -e with-tailwindcss`. I have disabled the experimental features and am not using the NextJS 13 app directory and only working inside the traditional pages directory.

I am using Node version 18.13.0 on Firefox on a Windows computer.

**Reproduction URL** - https://github.com/slyofzero/tailwind-issue

---
I was trying to apply tailwind classes to the children element by only adding class names to the parent in this manner.

```tsx
const paragraph = "text-red-500";
const section = `leading-8 [&>p]:${paragraph}`;
```

These variables are then passed as the `classname` property for any tag or component.

I thought that this would apply red font color to all paragraphs inside a section tag but it doesn't, even though the developer tools show the `text-red-500` class on each paragraph.

The styles however are applied if we don't have any variables being passed as an arbitrary value or if we only have a formatted or a normal string as the classname. It just throws issues if the variable is passed as an arbitrary value.

**What does work -**
```tsx
const section = `leading-8 [&>p]:text-red-500`; //OR
const section = `leading-8 ${paragraph}`
```

It'll be really handy if we this can be fixed/enabled as it'll help really with scoping.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Formatted string variables don't work as classnames when passed as an arbitrary value" (#10557)

Issues.Title: New classes not added when symlink is present
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

v3.2.6

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

Angular 15.1.4

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v19.6.0

**What browser are you using?**

Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**

Linux

**Reproduction URL**

<https://github.com/bagbag/tailwind-symlink-bug>

**Describe your issue**

The project is a minimal angular project (--minimal) with only tailwind added.

The project has 2 changes:
1. Added tailwind classes to index.html and app.component.ts
2. Symlink: `ln -s ../../node_modules/@angular/core/README.md assets/README.md` 

New tailwind classes are not added in `ng serve` without restarting it. Try to change `bg-red-500` to `bg-green-500` in `app.component.ts`. The sqaure will disappear as `bg-green-500` is not added to the css output.

This issue can be fixed by removing the symlink. Now class changes are added without restarting `ng serve` (may even require `rm -rf .angular`).

It does not matter what file type it is, the existence of a symlink is enough to break it.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "New classes not added when symlink is present" (#10555)

Issues.Title: Cant npm i after last update
Issues.Body:
After I launch "npm i" got next error

```
npm ERR! code ENOENT
npm ERR! syscall open
npm ERR! path <path-to-project>\node_modules\tailwindcss\oxide-node-api-shim/package.json
npm ERR! errno -4058
npm ERR! enoent ENOENT: no such file or directory, open '<path-to-project>\node_modules\tailwindcss\oxide-node-api-shim\package.json'
npm ERR! enoent This is related to npm not being able to find a file.
npm ERR! enoent
```

I am sure that this error is because [this](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/commit/add16364b4b1100e1af23ad1ca6900a0b53cbba0) commit and error started to show right after new version released

Please, confirm if this problem on my side or yours, this issue literally block my work.

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

I don`t even use Tailwind CSS

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

"webpack": "^5.73.0"

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v18.12.1

**What browser are you using?**

Not related

**What operating system are you using?**

Windows

Issues.Body:
_**Maintainer's note:** This issue has been fixed in v3.2.6._

---

*Tailwind*: `v3.2.5`
*Node*: `v19.6.0`
*Yarn*: `v1.22.19`

When trying to install new *Tailwind* version `3.2.5` using *Yarn*, I get that error:
`error Package "" refers to a non-existing file '"/Users/akoraie/MyApp/assets/oxide-node-api-shim"'.`

Issues.Title: Prepare for the `v3.2.5` release
Issues.Body:
This PR is a preparation PR for the `v3.2.5` release.

It reverts a bunch of new futures, so that only the necessary bug fixes are included.

- Revert "add caption-side utilities (#10470)"
- Revert "Add support for configuring default `font-variation-settings` for a `font-family` (#10515)"
- Revert "feat: add hyphens (#10071)"
- Revert "Add logical properties support for inline direction"
- Revert "Add `delay-0` and `duration-0` by default"
- Revert "Support using variables as arbitrary values without `var()`"
- Revert "Add `line-height` modifier support to `font-size` utilities"

Once we released `v3.2.5`, then we can revert this PR. üëç

---

This PR is a diff against `master` so that we can see the "removal" of new features. If you want to compare it against `v3.2.4` itself, then you can use: [`v3.2.4...prepare/release-3.2.5`](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/compare/v3.2.4...prepare/release-3.2.5)

<!--

üëã Hey, thanks for your interest in contributing to Tailwind!

**Please ask first before starting work on any significant new features.**

It's never a fun experience to have your pull request declined after investing a lot of time and effort into a new feature. To avoid this from happening, we request that contributors create an issue to first discuss any significant new features. This includes things like adding new utilities, creating new at-rules, or adding new component examples to the documentation.

https://github.com/tailwindcss/tailwindcss/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md

-->

Issues.Title: Update sass: 1.57.1 ‚Üí 1.58.0 (minor)
Issues.Body:
Here is everything you need to know about this update. Please take a good look at what changed and the test results before merging this pull request. ### What changed? #### ‚ú≥Ô∏è sass (1.57.1 ‚Üí 1.58.0) ¬∑ [Repo](https://github.com/sass/dart-sass) ¬∑ [Changelog](https://github.com/sass/dart-sass/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md)
Release Notes

1.58.0

To install Sass 1.58.0, download one of the packages below and add it to your PATH, or see the Sass website for full installation instructions.

Changes

  • Remove sourcemap comments from Sass sources. The generated sourcemap comment for the compiled CSS output remains unaffected.

  • Fix a bug in @extend logic where certain selectors with three or more combinators were incorrectly considered superselectors of similar selectors with fewer combinators, causing them to be incorrectly trimmed from the output.

  • Produce a better error message for a number with a leading + or -, a decimal point, but no digits.

  • Produce a better error message for a nested property whose name starts with --.

  • Fix a crash when a selector ends in an escaped backslash.

  • Add the relative length units from CSS Values 4 and CSS Contain 3 as known units to validate bad computation in calc.

Command Line Interface

  • The --watch flag will now track loads through calls to meta.load-css() as long as their URLs are literal strings without any interpolation.

See the full changelog for changes in earlier releases.

Does any of this look wrong? Please let us know.

Commits

See the full diff on Github. The new version differs by 9 commits:

  • Track dependencies through `meta.load-css()` with `--watch` (#1877)
  • Add all CSS length units in known compatibilities (#1868)
  • Update CI Node versions to 18/16/14 (#1871)
  • Fix escaped backslash crash (#1870)
  • Return an error when using a custom property in a propset instead of crashing (#1874)
  • Fix an edge case in superselector computation (#1866)
  • Don't crash when parsing `+.` (#1865)
  • Remove sourcemap comments from Sass sources (#1860)
  • Delete dead code (#1864)
#### ‚ú≥Ô∏è @‚Äãswc/cli (0.1.59 ‚Üí 0.1.61) ¬∑ [Repo](https://github.com/swc-project/cli)
Commits

See the full diff on Github. The new version differs by 5 commits:

  • v0.1.61
  • refactor: replace bin-wrapper with @mole-inc/bin-wrapper (#194)
  • v0.1.60
  • Fix https://github.com/swc-project/swc/issues/6880
  • Handle missing dependencies/devDependencies (#191)

Issues.Title: why key object understands as classname
Issues.Body:
**package version** ``` "next": "13.0.6", "react": "18.2.0", "react-dom": "18.2.0", "autoprefixer": "10.4.13", "postcss": "8.4.21", "tailwindcss": "3.2.4" "@tailwindcss/line-clamp": "0.4.2", "tailwind-scrollbar": "2.1.0", "tailwind-scrollbar-hide": "1.1.7", "typescript": "4.9.5" ``` **tailwind.config.js** ``` /** @type {import('tailwindcss').Config} */ module.exports = { content: [ "./app/**/*.{js,ts,jsx,tsx}", "./pages/**/*.{js,ts,jsx,tsx}", "./components/**/*.{js,ts,jsx,tsx}", // Or if using `src` directory: "./src/**/*.{js,ts,jsx,tsx}", ], experimental: { optimizeUniversalDefaults: true, }, theme: { extend: {}, }, plugins: [ require('tailwind-scrollbar'), require('tailwind-scrollbar-hide'), require('@tailwindcss/line-clamp'), ], corePlugins: { preflight: false, float: false, animation: true, container: false, boxShadowColor: false, backgroundOpacity: false, textOpacity: false, borderOpacity: false, }, } ``` **postcss.config.js** ``` module.exports = { plugins: { tailwindcss: {}, autoprefixer: {}, }, } ``` **I have something like this in my page** ` const cars = { filter: 'sport', } ` **i use it** `
{cars.filter}
` and without using any class from tailwind, I get this css after build `*{scrollbar-color:auto;scrollbar-width:auto}.filter{--tw-blur: ;--tw-brightness: ;--tw-contrast: ;--tw-grayscale: ;--tw-hue-rotate: ;--tw-invert: ;--tw-saturate: ;--tw-sepia: ;--tw-drop-shadow: ;filter:var(--tw-blur) var(--tw-brightness) var(--tw-contrast) var(--tw-grayscale) var(--tw-hue-rotate) var(--tw-invert) var(--tw-saturate) var(--tw-sepia) var(--tw-drop-shadow)}` **there shouldn't be .filter classname here because I don't use it anywhere**
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "why key object understands as classname" (#10528)

Issues.Title: hover:decoration-current not working
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

3.2.4

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

    "next": "13.1.6",
    "autoprefixer": "^10.4.13",
    "postcss": "^8.4.21",
    "tailwindcss": "^3.2.4"

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v18

**What browser are you using?**

Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**

macOS

**Describe your issue**

Hi, i'm trying to use the class "hover:decoration-current" on a button that is "decoration-transparent" by default and has a "text-white" class. It does not have any effect. If I'm using "hover:decoration-yellow" for instance, it works. When I'm doing my own css class (.link:hover { text-decoration-color: currentColor; }), the white color is applied as expected.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "hover:decoration-current not working" (#10522)

Issues.Title: How do I customize the margin value
Issues.Body:
How do I customize the margin value

The default mr mt ml mb is 1emÔºåHow to set mr ml mt mb Custom 18px or 20px

How to do it margin & padding

my: margin : 20px 0
mx: margin : 0 20px
ml : margin-left: 20px
mt: margin-top: 20px
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "How do I customize the margin value" (#10519)

Issues.Title: `PluginAPI` Type declaration is missing the helper function `addDefaults`
Issues.Body:
https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/blob/7b3de616e9c26211c605d2378b9ceb4888a8cfa1/types/config.d.ts#L261

The plugin api provides an object with helper functions to every registered plugin. The object includes a function called `addDefaults` that can be used to register `:root` level CSS custom properties.
Since it is provided to the plugins - I guess it is there for some reason, so I think it make sense to also include it in the type definition of the API

The function is defined in [here](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/blob/ef6f9ee6c2df6ff3ecfa4fda127ae7f672735e47/src/lib/setupContextUtils.js#L315) and is used in core plugins such as [border spacing](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/blob/f821c71b7ebe3c56b5b9a2d39da0877ca3a2f40a/src/corePlugins.js#L782) and [transform](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/blob/f821c71b7ebe3c56b5b9a2d39da0877ca3a2f40a/src/corePlugins.js#L875)

Open console in this example to see the list of helper functions - https://play.tailwindcss.com/R8vrYWtvNR 

If, for some reason, this method should remain "secret" and be used only for core plugins (e.g. it's a bad practice / its signature might change without introducing a breaking change) - then I think that the library should separate the registration of core plugins for external plugins, and create a different api for that. as long as the function is defined - it should be documented and typed 
(I've opened a [separate issue](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss.com/issues/1502#issue-1574161695) regarding the lack of documentation)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "`PluginAPI` Type declaration is missing the helper function `addDefaults`" (#10514)

Issues.Title: Add "object-inherit" util!
Issues.Body:
Adds a object-inherit utility.

As with no object inherit, the typical use-case would be to control what happens when no value is specified. Specially when using multiple components in react or other areas we would not just need to inherit the objects and instead of remaking them. Understanding that typically tailwind inherits both, I think there could be some additional use cases here.

Thank you, 
Zack D.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Add "object-inherit" util! " (#10506)

Issues.Title: Sort by `layer` inside `variants` layer
Issues.Body:
This PR fixes a sorting issue within the `variants` layer.

We currently have a whole system for sorting the utilties / components already. Right now we also have a "variants" layer, this is to ensure that we always have variants at the end of the file regardless of the `parentLayer` (base, utilties, components).

That said, we also have to make sure that within this `variants` layer we also sort by the `parentLayer`.

Fixes: #10494

<!--

üëã Hey, thanks for your interest in contributing to Tailwind!

**Please ask first before starting work on any significant new features.**

It's never a fun experience to have your pull request declined after investing a lot of time and effort into a new feature. To avoid this from happening, we request that contributors create an issue to first discuss any significant new features. This includes things like adding new utilities, creating new at-rules, or adding new component examples to the documentation.

https://github.com/tailwindcss/tailwindcss/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md

-->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Sort by `layer` inside `variants` layer" (#10505)

  • [jest-config] [BREAKING] Remove undocumented collectCoverageOnlyFrom option (#13156)
  • [jest-environment-jsdom] [BREAKING] Upgrade to jsdom@20 (#13037, #13058)
  • [@jest/globals] Add jest.Mocked, jest.MockedClass, jest.MockedFunction and jest.MockedObject utility types (#12727)
  • [jest-mock] [BREAKING] Refactor Mocked* utility types. MaybeMockedDeep and MaybeMocked became Mocked and MockedShallow respectively; only deep mocked variants of MockedClass, MockedFunction and MockedObject are exported (#13123, #13124)
  • [jest-mock] [BREAKING] Change the default jest.mocked helper‚Äôs behavior to deep mocked (#13125)
  • [jest-snapshot] [BREAKING] Let babel find config when updating inline snapshots (#13150)
  • [@jest/test-result, @jest/types] [BREAKING] Replace Bytes and Milliseconds types with number (#13155)
  • [jest-worker] Adds workerIdleMemoryLimit option which is used as a check for worker memory leaks >= Node 16.11.0 and recycles child workers as required (#13056, #13105, #13106, #13107)
  • [pretty-format] [BREAKING] Remove ConvertAnsi plugin in favour of jest-serializer-ansi-escapes (#13040)
  • [pretty-format] Allow to opt out from sorting object keys with compareKeys: null (#12443)

Fixes

  • [jest-config] Fix testing multiple projects with TypeScript config files (#13099)
  • [@jest/expect-utils] Fix deep equality of ImmutableJS Record (#13055)
  • [jest-haste-map] Increase the maximum possible file size that jest-haste-map can handle (#13094)
  • [jest-runtime] Properly support CJS re-exports from dual packages (#13170)
  • [jest-snapshot] Make prettierPath optional in SnapshotState (#13149)
  • [jest-snapshot] Fix parsing error from inline snapshot files with JSX (#12760)
  • [jest-worker] When a process runs out of memory worker exits correctly and doesn't spin indefinitely (#13054)

Chore & Maintenance

  • [*] [BREAKING] Drop support for Node v12 and v17 (#13033)
  • [docs] Fix webpack name (#13049)
  • [docs] Explicit how to set n for --bail (#13128)
  • [docs] Update Enzyme URL (#13166)
  • [jest-leak-detector] Remove support for weak-napi (#13035)
  • [jest-snapshot] [BREAKING] Require rootDir as argument to SnapshotState (#13150)

New Contributors

  • @makstech made their first contribution in #13049
  • @sa2taka made their first contribution in #13055
  • @matheus-rodrigues00 made their first contribution in #13090
  • @lanpai made their first contribution in #13094
  • @Zebreus made their first contribution in #13099
  • @backmask made their first contribution in #13106
  • @liuxingbaoyu made their first contribution in #13120
  • @Trim made their first contribution in #13128
  • @kkyusufk made their first contribution in #13142
  • @KrishnaPG made their first contribution in #13157
  • @dev-itsheng made their first contribution in #13115
  • @jeffslofish made their first contribution in #13166

Full Changelog: v28.1.3...v29.0.0
